result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Razo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment or counseling.
- No Contact with any known gang members.
- Defendant is prohibited from being present where controlled substances are used, sold, or packaged for sale.
- No firearms may be present in the defendant's residence.

supervisions.notes: **10/14/2015  Extended supervision commuted to two (2) years.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court costs, fees, surcharges  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendasnt that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A Razo

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 720-3629, and mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729.  jm

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
Received this day, DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa.  jm

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 10/14/2015:  Extended Supervision is commuted to two years.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Br. 25, for review. mag
DOC request for sentence clarification.
Original GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (59 pages) commencing AUGUST 4, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Miguel A Razo in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Miguel A Razo in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 17. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to Branch 25.
Letters on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Miguel A Razo not in court, in custody.  Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Defense counsel request case set for plea and sentencing. Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Miguel A Razo not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant not produced, for the purposes of scheduling. Case held off the record.   Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 3-31-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miguel A Razo in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Miguel A Razo in custody.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Miguel A Razo in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Miguel A Razo in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
